--- title: "Chub_mackerel" date-modified: "2023-05-24" execute: echo: true eval: true warning: false freeze: true editor: visual --- ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} pacman::p_load(jsonlite, igraph, tidygraph, ggraph, visNetwork, lubridate, clock, tidyverse, graphlayouts) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} mc2chub_mackerel_data <- fromJSON("data/chub_mackerel.json") ``` ::: Data Wrangling Extracting the nodes The code chunk is used to extract nodes data table from mc2_data list object and save the output in a tibble data frame object called mc2_nodes. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} mc2chub_mackerel_nodes <- as_tibble(mc2chub_mackerel_data$nodes) %>% select(id, shpcountry, rcvcountry) ``` ::: Extracting the edges ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} mc2chub_mackerel_edges <- as_tibble(mc2chub_mackerel_data$links) %>% mutate(ArrivalDate = ymd(arrivaldate)) %>% mutate(Year = year(ArrivalDate)) %>% select(source, target, ArrivalDate, Year, hscode, valueofgoods_omu) %>% distinct() ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} hscodes_filtered <- c("302100", "304100", "303100", "303910", "160414","305400", "305200", "306130", "306170", "306230","306190", "160520", "307110", "307990", "307190", "160550") mc2chub_mackerel_edges_aggregated <- mc2chub_mackerel_edges %>% #filter(substr(as.character(hscode), 1, 4) %in% hscodes_filtered) %>% #filter(hscode %in% hscodes_filtered) %>% group_by(source, target, hscode, Year) %>% summarise(weights = n()) %>% filter(source!=target) %>% filter(weights > 1) %>% ungroup() ``` ::: Preparing nodes data Instead of using the nodes data table extracted from mc2_data, we will prepare a new nodes data table by using the source and target fields of mc2_edges_aggregated data table. This is necessary to ensure that the nodes in nodes data tables include all the source and target values. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} id1 <- mc2chub_mackerel_edges_aggregated %>% select(source) %>% rename(id = source) id2 <- mc2chub_mackerel_edges_aggregated %>% select(target) %>% rename(id = target) mc2chub_mackerel_nodes_extracted <- rbind(id1, id2) %>% distinct() ``` ::: Building the tidy graph data model The following code chunk is used ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} mc2chub_mackerel_graph <- tbl_graph(nodes = mc2chub_mackerel_nodes_extracted, edges = mc2chub_mackerel_edges_aggregated, directed = TRUE) mc2chub_mackerel_graph ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tbl_graph: 5 nodes and 6 edges # # A directed acyclic multigraph with 1 component # # A tibble: 5 × 1 id 1 Ocean Quest A/S Logistics 2 -28 3 Estrella del Mar Tilapia Oyj Marine 4 Uttarakhand Market Limited Liability Company Nautical 5 Volga River LLC Enterprises # # A tibble: 6 × 5 from to hscode Year weights 1 1 2 160414 2034 2 2 1 3 160414 2034 4 3 1 4 160414 2034 6 # ℹ 3 more rows ``` ::: ::: Visualising the network graph The following code chunk is used to plot the network graph ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggraph(mc2chub_mackerel_graph, layout = "fr") + geom_edge_link(aes()) + geom_node_point(aes()) + theme_graph() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Chub_mackerel_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} g <- ggraph(mc2chub_mackerel_graph, layout = "nicely") + geom_edge_link(aes()) + geom_node_point(aes(colour = id, size = 8)) g + theme_graph() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Chub_mackerel_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=1728} ::: ::: In-betweeness check ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} g <- mc2chub_mackerel_graph %>% mutate(betweenness_centrality = centrality_betweenness()) %>% ggraph(layout = "fr") + geom_edge_link(aes(width=weights), alpha=0.2) + scale_edge_width(range = c(0.1, 5)) + geom_node_point(aes(colour = id, size=betweenness_centrality)) g + theme_graph() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Chub_mackerel_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=1728} ::: ::: Interactive Network Diagram Before we can plot the interactive network graph, we need to prepare the data model by using the code chunk below. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} mc2chub_mackerel_edges_aggregated <- mc2chub_mackerel_edges %>% left_join(mc2chub_mackerel_nodes, by = c("source" = "id")) %>% rename(from = source) %>% left_join(mc2chub_mackerel_nodes, by = c("target" = "id")) %>% rename(to = target) %>% #filter(MainSubject == "Work related") %>% group_by(from, to) %>% summarise(weight = n()) %>% filter(from!=to) %>% filter(weight > 1) %>% ungroup() ``` ::: #Testing ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # Generate a continuous color palette with 400 colors num_colors <- 5 color_palette <- colorRampPalette(c("red", "blue"))(num_colors) # Assign colors to the "color" attribute in the node data mc2chub_mackerel_nodes_extracted$color <- color_palette # Plot the network with different colors for nodes visNetwork(mc2chub_mackerel_nodes_extracted, mc2chub_mackerel_edges_aggregated) %>% visIgraphLayout(layout = "layout_with_fr") %>% visOptions(highlightNearest = TRUE, nodesIdSelection = TRUE) %>% visLegend() %>% visLayout(randomSeed = 123) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: :::
